marketNews.title: IHSG +5.5% This Week Shows Signs of Recovery
marketNews.content: IHSG strengthened by 5.5% since the start of the week on Thursday (6 March 2025, after being in a bearish trend with a 21% decline from its recent peak in mid-September 2024. The rally raises the question of whether the downtrend has ended and a rebound can continue, or if the market could fall again. We examined historical IHSG movements to answer this. In the past 20 years, there were eight instances where the index fell significantly (defined as a minimum 15% decline). Two of those were caused by massive crises – the Covid-19 pandemic (-38.4%) and the Global Financial Crisis (-61.6%). Excluding those two, the average weakening from the remaining six events was -21.4% with a range of 15.8-26.9%. Full rebound: in all eight cases the index eventually recovered to pre-decline levels, with five cases where it even exceeded the prior level. The first-volume trade-war decline (Feb-July 2018) also saw a rebound, showing similarity to the current situation. Important notes and disclaimer: two significant declines (2005-2006) were excluded because the index level was below 2,000, making them less comparable. Decline and rebound measurements may contain chart-analysis subjectivity. There is no certainty that the current decline will not turn into a crisis with historically massive drops. Key takeaway: if investors judge the current situation is not a crisis and the likelihood of a crisis is low, history shows the current decline is near its end and could be followed by a significant rebound.

marketNews.title: Indonesia’s DME Downstream Project Requires $11 Billion Funding
marketNews.content: The Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Tri Winarno, said that the dimethyl ether (DME) downstream project to be financed by the Danantara Investment Management Agency will require US$11 billion, representing 27.5% of the total investment for the 21 downstream projects previously announced to be funded by Danantara at US$40 billion. The DME project, which converts coal into LPG-grade fuel, could reduce state revenue because the Job Creation Law signed by President Joko Widodo exempts royalties for coal-to-LPG projects. In 2023, foreign investor Air Products and Chemicals Inc. withdrew from a coal-gasification project with PT BAKT (PTBA).

marketNews.title: BEI Proposes Reopening Broker Codes and Investor Domicile
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) announced that it is submitting a proposal to the Financial Services Authority (OJK) to reopen broker codes and investor domicile information in a non-real-time manner, following market participants’ feedback earlier this week. BEI had closed broker codes and investor domicile in December 2021 and June 2022 to reduce spread and protect investors from aggressive trading.

marketNews.title: Minister Proposes Cash THR for Ojek Online Drivers
marketNews.content: The Minister of Manpower, Yassierli, said on Wednesday (5 March) that the government proposes that the holiday allowance (THR) for online-motorcycle-driver (ojol) workers be paid in cash. The final formula for the THR payment is still under discussion with stakeholders.

marketNews.title: U.S. Withdraws from JETP, Affecting Indonesia’s Climate Funding
marketNews.content: The United States announced it is withdrawing from the Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP), a collaboration of wealthy nations that helps developing countries shift from coal to cleaner energy. The United States is one of ten donor countries in JETP, which was launched in 2021. Indonesia, South Africa, Vietnam and Senegal are among the first beneficiaries, receiving loans, guarantees and grants. The U.S. commitment to Indonesia and Vietnam exceeds US$3 billion, mostly delivered through commercial loans.

marketNews.title: U.S. Temporarily Waives 25% Auto-Parts Tariff for Mexico and Canada
marketNews.content: The White House’s press secretary, Karoline Leavitt, said on Wednesday (5 March) that the United States is waiving the 25% import tariff on automobiles and parts for Mexico and Canada for one month. The announcement came a day after the U.S. imposed the tariff on those countries and followed a statement by U.S. Trade Secretary Howard Lutnick that the U.S. could grant tariff relief for goods covered by the US-MCA. The timing followed meetings with Ford, General Motors and Stellantis on Tuesday (4 March).

marketNews.title: WTI Crude Oil Prices Fall 3% to $66.21 per Barrel
marketNews.content: West Texas Intermediate (WTI) futures for April 2025 fell 3% to US$66.21 per barrel on Wednesday (5 March), the lowest level since mid-November 2024. The decline followed the release of U.S. crude-oil inventories that rose by 3.6 million barrels to 433.8 million barrels for the week ended 28 February, far above the consensus expectation of a 341,000-barrel increase. The inventory surge came amid an escalation of the trade-war, raising concerns over slower growth and energy demand. The price drop was also supported by OPEC+’s decision to continue its production-recovery plan in April 2025, the first increase in output since 2022, which Reuters estimates will add 138,000 barrels per day.

marketNews.title: Attorney General Refutes Alleged Pertamina Corruption Involving Erick Thohir and ADRO
marketNews.content: The Director General of the Attorney General’s Office, Harli Siregar, on Wednesday (5 March) refuted reports that State-Owned Enterprises Minister Erick Thohir, his son Garibaldi “Boy” Thohir, and the beneficiary Alamtri Resources Indonesia (ADRO) were involved in a Pertamina subsidiary corruption case. Earlier, a video on social media claimed the Attorney General’s Office had obtained financial records and documents showing their involvement, which the office denied.

marketNews.title: Waskita Karya Projects Slowing Leads to Expected 2025 Net Loss of 3.97 Trillion Rupiah
marketNews.content: Waskita Karya (WSKT) expects a net loss of 3.97 trillion rupiah in 2025 (versus a 3 trillion-rupiah loss in 2024) as infrastructure project pipelines from the government slow down.

marketNews.title: East Ventures’ Fore Coffee Chain Plans IPO by April 2025
marketNews.content: East Ventures plans to bring the coffee-shop chain Fore to an initial public offering as early as April 2025, targeting at least IDR 300 billion in proceeds and a post-IPO market capitalisation of about IDR 1.8 trillion. The source said the funds will be used for expansion, while the exact timing and size of the IPO may change. Existing shareholders, including East Ventures, do not intend to sell shares in the offering. Fore was founded in 2018 and now operates more than 200 stores in 44 Indonesian cities.

tickerNews.title: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Increases Stake in PTRO to 41.9% via 39.7 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi, through its subsidiary PT Kreasi Jasa Persada, bought approximately 39.7 million PTRO shares at an average price of IDR 3,026 per share on 4-5 March 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 120 billion. After the transaction, PT Kreasi Jasa Persada’s ownership in PTRO rose from 41.519% to 41.913%.

tickerNews.title: RATU Shares Sold by Controlling Owner RAJA, Ownership Falls to 75.34%
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja (RAJA) sold approximately 126.5 million RATU shares on 5 March 2025; the transaction value was not disclosed. After the sale, RAJA’s ownership in RATU fell from 80% to 75.34%. On the same day, a crossing transaction of RATU shares worth IDR 149 billion, consisting of about 130 million shares at an average price of IDR 1,175 per share, was executed at a price 80% lower than the closing price of IDR 5,975 per share.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Increases Stake in SCMA to 62.8% via 74.3 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK) bought approximately 74.3 million SCMA shares at an average price of IDR 202 per share on 5 March 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 15 billion. After the purchase, EMTK’s ownership in SCMA increased from 62.72% to 62.82%.

tickerNews.title: Indomobil Multi Jasa Plans Up to 3 Billion-Share Rights Issue
tickerNews.content: Indomobil Multi Jasa announced a plan to issue up to 3 billion new shares in a rights issue, with the issue price, ratio and dilution effect not yet disclosed. Proceeds will be used to strengthen capital structure and to develop the company’s business.

tickerNews.title: ESSA Announces Blue-Ammonia and SAF Projects with US$20 Million 2025 Capex
tickerNews.content: ESSA Industries Indonesia’s President Director, Kanishk Laroya, said the company’s blue-ammonia project is in a feasibility-study stage with a target to start construction in 2027 and commissioning in 4Q 2028. The sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) project is planned to start construction in 2026 and be commissioned in 1Q 2028, with a planned capacity of 150,000 tonnes per year. For 2025, ESSA allocated US$20 million in capex, fully funded from internal cash for routine ammonia plant maintenance.

tickerNews.title: ABM Investama Cancels Acquisition of Two Citra Tubindo Subsidiaries
tickerNews.content: ABM Investama announced that the company cancelled the acquisition of two Citra Tubindo subsidiaries (CTBN), PT Sarana Citranusa Kabil and PT Citra Pembina Pengangkutan Industries. The earlier November 2024 agreement to acquire the two companies was terminated after the board decided to reconsider the transaction.

tickerNews.title: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera Shares Bought by President Director Teguh Patriawan
tickerNews.content: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera’s President Director, Teguh Patriawan, bought approximately 46.9 million NSSS shares at an average price of IDR 240 per share on 5 March 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 11.2 billion. After the purchase, his ownership rose from 10.293% to 10.485%.

tickerNews.title: Dharma Polimetal Posts 4Q 2024 Net Profit of IDR 167 Billion
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal reported net profit of IDR 167 billion in 4Q 2024, an 81% year-over-year increase but a 4% quarter-over-quarter decline. The 2024 full-year net profit was IDR 579 billion, a 5% year-over-year decline, matching the consensus estimate of 101% of consensus. The 4Q24 profit surge was driven by a low-base effect, while the 2024 profit decline was offset by a 12% year-over-year increase in the motorcycle segment and a 21% year-over-year decline in the automobile segment; gross-margin for motorcycles was 22% versus 13% for cars. tickerNews.title: Arkora Hydro Director Purchases 1.04 Million ARKO Shares
tickerNews.content: Arkora Hydro’s President Director, Aldo Henry Artoko, bought approximately 1.04 million ARKO shares at an average price of IDR 928 per share between 3 March and 5 March 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 1 billion. After the purchase, Aldo’s ownership in ARKO increased from 0.11% to 0.14%.
